description: Parker's partition triangle read by rows.
comments: The entries in row n are the coefficients of q^(k(n+1)) in the q-binomial coefficient [2n,n] where k runs from 0 to n-1 - _James A. Sellers_.
references: R. K. Guy, Parker's permutation problem involves the Catalan numbers, Amer. Math. Monthly 100 (1993), 287-289.
mathematica: s[n_] := s[n] = Series[ Product[(1-q^(2n-k)) / (1-q^(k+1)), {k, 0, n-1}], {q, 0, n^2}]; t[n_, k_] := SeriesCoefficient[ s[n], k(n+1)]; Flatten[ Table[ t[n, k], {n, 0, 11}, {k, 0, n-1}]] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Jan 27 2012 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
